dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: William Li, the so-called Elon Musk of China, just got a massive 5 billion yuan lifeline for Xpeng.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: William Li, the so-called Elon Musk of China, just got a massive five billion yuan lifeline for Xpeng.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: William Li (left) Dubbed the Elon Musk of China, Li has been waging a campaign of cutting costs and raising cash from investors for NIO, which still has yet to turn a profit. A capital injection of 5 billion yuan ($733 million) in June by investors including the local government of Hefei amounted to a much-needed lifeline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that capital injection from Shanghai's local government came right when they really needed it, didn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that capital injection from Shanghai's local government came right when they really needed it, didn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A capital injection of 5 billion yuan ($733 million) in June by investors including the local government of Hefei amounted to a much-needed lifeline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And then in June, uh, sales actually hit 1.37 billion yuan, which was way stronger than expected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And then in June, uh, sales actually hit one point three seven billion yuan, which was way stronger than expected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The turning point came in May when Li reported stronger than expected sales of 1.37 billion yuan ($194 million) in the first quarter, and then predicted that revenue and shipments would more than double in the following quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And that momentum carried into the third quarter—deliveries doubled to over 10,000 vehicles. That's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that momentum carried into the third quarter-deliveries doubled to over ten thousand vehicles. That's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It turns out that NIOs deliveries actually tripled to a record 10,331 vehicles in the second quarter compared to a year earlier, and revenue rose to 3.72 billion yuan, as Chinas auto market was showing early signs of a post-pandemic recovery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But despite that, some analysts, like Yale Zhang from Automotive Foresight, are still pretty skeptical about Xpeng keeping up the pace.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But despite that, some analysts, like Yale Zhang from Automotive Foresight, are still pretty skeptical about Xpeng keeping up the pace.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company is doing well this year. It found investment, accelerated new vehicle launches, and kept up good service quality, said Yale Zhang, managing director of Shanghai-based consultancy Automotive Foresight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he pointed out they delayed new vehicle launches and struggled with service quality, which is worrying for investors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he pointed out they delayed new vehicle launches and struggled with service quality, which is worrying for investors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It found investment, accelerated new vehicle launches, and kept up good service quality, said Yale Zhang, managing director of Shanghai-based consultancy Automotive Foresight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Li himself predicted only up to 9,500 deliveries last quarter, which is actually lower than what they ended up achieving earlier.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Li himself predicted only up to nine thousand, five hundred deliveries last quarter, which is actually lower than what they ended up achieving earlier.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He predicted during an analyst call in August that the car maker would deliver up to 11,500 vehicles in the third quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Still, his net worth shot up to 1.9 billion dollars thanks to Nio's share performance, so it's not all bad news for him personally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, his net worth shot up to one point nine billion dollars thanks to Nio's share performance, so it's not all bad news for him personally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nios soaring share price on the Nasdaq lifted Lis net worth from $572.4 million on May 22 to its current level of $2.9 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but Xpeng's fundraising took a hit—they had to reduce their share offering by 10% in September.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but Xpeng's fundraising took a hit-they had to reduce their share offering by ten percent in September.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In August, the company boosted the size of its American depositary share offering by 20%, selling 88.5 million shares at $17 apiece.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And now they're up against Tesla's Model 3, which is priced really competitively from that Shanghai factory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now they're up against Tesla's Model three, which is priced really competitively from that Shanghai factory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By pricing his electric SUVs at a range of 358,000 to 558,000 yuan, the billionaire car builder is targeting Chinas wealthier consumersa market segment Tesla also hopes to win with its locally manufactured Model 3s, said John Zeng, a Shanghai-based director at consultancy LMC Automotive. The Model 3 has been priced between 271,550 to 419,800 yuan, after delivery from Teslas Shanghai factory, which kicked off in late 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and Xpeng's new EC6 model got delayed, plus they're changing their battery strategy—no more selling cars without battery packs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and Xpeng's new EC6 model got delayed, plus they're changing their battery strategy-no more selling cars without battery packs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In July, the company launched its new EC6 model, a 5-seater electric coupe SUV that has a starting price of 368,000 yuan. In August, NIO began to allow consumers to buy its cars without battery packs, allowing them instead to have the option of renting the components later for a monthly fee at its battery-swap stations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Switching to leasing batteries monthly instead… I wonder if that'll help or hurt them against rivals like Nio, who don't even do battery swaps.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Switching to leasing batteries monthly instead... I wonder if that'll help or hurt them against rivals like Nio, who don't even do battery swaps.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: NIO, on the other hand, is doing battery swaps. We are waiting to see if this will drive sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a risky move, for sure. The whole EV sector in China is just so volatile right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a risky move, for sure. The whole E V sector in China is just so volatile right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teng Yong, a Shanghai-based partner at consultancy Oliver Wyman, said bullish market sentiment towards EV companies could pave the way for any new fundraising activities. Buoyed by strong sales, Tesla surged almost sixfold this year, making founder Elon Musk the worlds fifth-richest person with a net worth of $85.8 billion.

artist_script:
HostA: William Li, the so-called Elon Musk of China, just got a massive 5 billion yuan lifeline for Xpeng.
HostB: Yeah, and that capital injection from Shanghai’s local government came right when they really needed it, didn’t it?
HostA: Absolutely. And then in June, uh, sales actually hit 1.37 billion yuan, which was way stronger than expected.
HostB: And that momentum carried into the third quarter—deliveries doubled to over 10,000 vehicles. That’s huge.
HostA: But despite that, some analysts, like Yale Zhang from Automotive Foresight, are still pretty skeptical about Xpeng keeping up the pace.
HostB: Right, he pointed out they delayed new vehicle launches and struggled with service quality, which is worrying for investors.
HostA: And Li himself predicted only up to 9,500 deliveries last quarter, which is actually lower than what they ended up achieving earlier.
HostB: Still, his net worth shot up to 1.9 billion dollars thanks to Nio’s share performance, so it’s not all bad news for him personally.
HostA: True, but Xpeng’s fundraising took a hit—they had to reduce their share offering by 10% in September.
HostB: And now they’re up against Tesla’s Model 3, which is priced really competitively from that Shanghai factory.
HostA: Exactly, and Xpeng’s new EC6 model got delayed, plus they’re changing their battery strategy—no more selling cars without battery packs.
HostB: Switching to leasing batteries monthly instead… I wonder if that’ll help or hurt them against rivals like Nio, who don’t even do battery swaps.
HostA: It’s a risky move, for sure. The whole EV sector in China is just so volatile right now.
